title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 212.37 - Executions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 212.37 - Executions

State Regulations
(a) No
execution may be issued against any party who has appeared by an attorney in an
action or proceeding, unless a copy of the judgment has been duly served upon
the attorney for such party. (b) No execution may be issued against
any party who has appeared in person in any action and who defaults in
answering either the original or an amended or supplemental complaint, unless a
copy of the judgment has been duly served upon such party personally or mailed
to such party by certified mail at the address stated in the notice of
appearance or in the last pleading or paper filed by the party with the clerk, or at the address last furnished by the party to the clerk in
writing. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22
ยง
212.37

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
